intro: Platysace cirrosa, commonly known as the hairy strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped, contributing to its common name. The flowers, which bloom in clusters, are often pink or purple and attract various pollinators.
